pageContext.analysis: Trump did not create these jobs, obviously; businesses did. But Trump also never achieved a gain of 700,000 new manufacturing jobs except in his own mind. Before the coronavirus, manufacturers had added about 500,000 jobs since Trump took office. But manufacturing jobs growth had slumped badly in 2019, adding only 46,000 jobs during the year. U.S. manufacturing was in a mild recession for all of 2019, according to data released by the Federal Reserve.
